meanings.definition: To divide or separate into parts
meanings.sent1: She was comparting the puzzle pieces to put them together.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was comparting the students into groups for the project.
meanings.sent3: The chef was comparting the ingredients to make the perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: The river was comparting the land, creating a beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The artist was comparting the colors to create a masterpiece painting.

meanings.definition: To compare or contrast two or more things
meanings.sent1: He was comparting the prices of different laptops before making a decision.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys comparting different book genres to find her favorite.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were comparting their heights to see who was taller.
meanings.sent4: The scientist was comparting the data to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent5: The coach was comparting the players' skills to form the best team.
